document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

7B0099D0F49E43DCA30D1D633605AEA9.description:
With prompting and support, in small or large group settings, informally share recorded
information collected from research.

DF5EB592A4CC4866936D29CD7CCF903C.description:
With prompting and support, use drawing, writing, or dictation to record facts and
information collected from the research.

600E658322B94305BB550AE25000790C.description:
With prompting and support, find information on the topic from pictures, texts, people or
provided sources.

BB7089FCC42C4D86A96EA8AA0FE76178.description:
With prompting and support, generate a topic of interest and question to explore a given
topic.

C8A63C828D584CBDB24DC4FB0B711358.description:
The student will conduct research and listen to a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-level topics or solve problems using available
resources.

381BE411F66B46338D363A54C32D9487.description: **Standards related to Examining Media Messages are introduced in Grade Four.

ED8B4D2EB9B74867A9F88D1DC7A30D53.description: **Standards related to Integrating Multimodal Literacies are introduced in Grade Three.

37BF041B970D432382F0DB976565D509.description:
Retell, create, and dictate stories, rhymes, poems, and events in sequential order using
drama, props, and/or pictures indicating first, next and last events in a story.

4EEC62948E024DAF99BC11F01D166F71.description:
Participate in a variety of oral language activities, including choral speaking and recitation
of short poems, rhymes, songs, and stories with repeated patterns and refrains.

1C778C5105BD46078E4D0A320FCFC808.description: Speak audibly with appropriate pacing, prosody, and voice level.

6E0AED80DAC2483F93CCF98C4BB65AD6.description: Describe personal experiences using complete sentences.

2238776C3A6D4FE18EB93D599BF92808.description: Expressing ideas and needs in complete sentences.

B76F6C6A5AEF4073839BC50E4D424B8A.description:
Asking questions to seek help, get information, or clarify information for further
understanding.

ED504C50B7AF4A12AC75AF2CBCEE87CF.description: Respectfully building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

9E869D3CBCA34317BA2E411B8305F8F7.description:
Listening actively and following agreed-upon rules for participating in discussions
(e.g., waiting for a turn to speak without unnecessary interruptions and staying on
topic).

A73619CA7D77417486E26A91F99921EC.description:
Participate in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led)
on kindergarten topics and texts. This includes:

359F1E69E1D84C4092BACC318414CBBD.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

DD151E30910C472DA1EE26B2012733C0.description: Phonetically spell words containing unknown letter-sound correspondences.

96AC3294BE2B48F8BBD054C60E923EDE.description:
With guidance and support, identify statements and questions and use ending punctuation
(e.g., period and question mark).

C8493EF9443E4B98AC012F77B13197AD.description:
With guidance and support, begin each sentence with a capital letter and capitalize the
pronoun I.

8D0BCC15491E4AB78D819C0298FB57CC.description: Use verbs to locate specific actions.

E029C6A2EC4240E7BB759293F5130110.description: Use adjectives to describe specific objects (quantity, size, age, shape, color, or location).

31828B60D7BF4284BB0D77389B733B49.description: Use pronouns to identify individuals and groups (he, she, they, his, hers, their(s).

FBEBA8ECB0C340C8B1798357A123697E.description: Use nouns to identify and name people, places, and things.

6FB794B9860840C199226C1669D49703.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

0762AD50C7C64255B6CEB6A8FCB80228.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

D7AC421DD163446BA4ACFF6CC1FD5115.description: **See Language Usage for grade level expectations.

586C367912824FD7BB3ACF20ADF278CD.description:
Composing or dictating simple sentences that include a subject (noun) and
predicate(verb) focused on the topic.

34686E8EBA5A4ABB89055BAB1C1854FE.description:
Identifying the audience and purpose of the writing (e.g., letters, stories, “all about”
book, etc).

01C7F3C53C034584A862A42BDD4B55CE.description:
With guidance and support, use prewriting activities, including drawing and suggestions
from peers to generate ideas and plan writing or dictation. This includes:

961D8AADEB5045EC92F06D8D7814A7C4.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to write in response to texts heard.

0B5D105425EF4200AB027DE554B2618E.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose descriptive writing that
identifies a topic and provides one or more relevant details.

30072FC9EFC7454FA77548293E9336EE.description:
Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose narrative stories in
sequential order (beginning, middle, end).

D3F7E2F528E247629A56E4A8C9F65034.description: The student will write in a variety of forms, linked to kindergarten content and texts.

3D885C8B46E145128B2F911A18F1DE74.description:
With prompting and support, use phoneme/grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondences to
spell grade-level high-frequency words with accuracy.

3D63AC8F7486440A8AE196F2147A6172.description: Encode (spell) unknown words using logical invented spelling.

B68064D95BE04D829926BE87EA987DE1.description:
Encode (spell) one syllable words with short vowels and one syllable words beginning or
ending in a digraph (e.g., ch, sh, th, wh).

3C68ED28407F41CB9C0C1FE0EA5F3D88.description: Apply spaces between written words in phrase or sentence level writing.

D99A1BE9E380495992398699B0778F79.description: Accurately print first and last names, beginning each with a capital letter.

3D7ACB2E0E9E4858B24D177A504F840F.description: Write left to right and top to bottom.

98B70D97A00040B9B969DBB6E1618660.description:
Accurately and automatically print capital and lowercase letters of the alphabet
independently.

4B5D43465F124DD68A9E690A78669385.description: Use functional pencil grasp for letter formation.

DBDDC83776A140C99BAA58AEECB367C5.description: The student will print legibly in manuscript.

729EC7DED5E8424FAEC69BE6A01C4E6B.description:
With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events,
ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

DCED487D614C468197321A5B9000438B.description:
With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two
texts on the same topic.

5D3901B6EA5A49188D727778A99A168B.description:
With prompting and support, identify the purpose of common text features: table of
contents, headings, bolded words, and pictures.

C7B7A7710B6D4050BA5427ECBFC91363.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and key details of a text.

9322F1F767B247A1A941A311EAEFAD64.description:
With prompting and support, ask and answer literal (who, what, when, where) or inferential
(why, how) questions about what is read.

F112A0DD05EB438CB279E5E601A9D717.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of informational texts heard.

8C8C1DD2C823487DA35519576FEC5CB6.description: With prompting and support, monitor listening comprehension.

EC0216D14DF445399C4FC62C62B9EEF1.description:
With prompting and support, compare and contrast characters, plot events, or settings
between two familiar stories.

6CC01665C20F45D297F4D08BA2A8F645.description:
With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in
which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

DC03D7EDD40048E68417064B62522F1A.description: **Standards related to Craft and Style are introduced in Grade Three.

B9724087575A4168B39275DCE5616F1E.description:
With prompting and support, generate predictions about story characters and events using
the text.

DB30699C313F46CA949075EE43F98F9F.description:
With prompting and support, orally re-tell a familiar story in sequential order (beginning,
middle, end).

F0C74C2B49EC4430A158A4BD4A1EEBE1.description:
With prompting and support, demonstrate knowledge of story structure by orally
identifying characters, setting,important events, and details.

8FD0A0EA7B5D4CC0ADD75B798CE4C443.description:
With prompting and support, activate prior (experience) and background (content)
knowledge and make connections to what is read.

A4B8162CBAC94EC58E6C55426D247EB3.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of literary texts heard, to include fantasy, humor, fable/fairy tale,
realistic fiction, historical fiction, and folklore/tall tale.

E80BC38362D24343B6BC3B894E5040DB.description: Use newly learned words and phrases in discussions and speaking activities.

D52E1C309DBA43709181AC747339D01E.description:
Increase and develop breadth of vocabulary knowledge by listening to high
quality, complex text.

A82A2E557FE34353B1CD2DD37A5E7C8A.description:
Identify the purpose of simple reference materials (e.g., pictures, dictionary, digital
dictionary).

3F5A2CCB76B4456A9A52331251F0C01D.description: Use vocabulary from across content areas.

00507A417EEF4FCEB24736643998E35F.description: Ask questions about words not understood.

B8488987E7774192811B31926D2C6202.description: Discuss meanings of words from a variety of texts and experiences.

FEDCB7C5BE284EE880B66BCB452D1D3E.description:
The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on
kindergarten content and texts heard.

49E5A2229CB2452CB03D377091E5E5CC.description:
Regularly engage in listening to a series of conceptually related texts organized around
topics of study to build knowledge and vocabulary. Use this background knowledge as
context for new learning (Deep Reading on Topics to Build Knowledge and
Vocabulary, K-12).

ABDB1C2145FF4ACC843DA3F08F10F24E.description:
With prompting and support, when responding to text through discussions and/or writing,
draw several pieces of evidence from read-alouds to support claims, conclusions,
inferences, including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where
relevant evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

EC8C792229D44E618680AFD4760A3879.description:
Use knowledge of letter-sound correspondences to read and reread controlled decodable
sentences and texts that include phonic elements and irregular words (Reading Fluency,
K-12).

97890364C8794F458DBF41E465062234.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading and
listening to a range of texts. This includes fluently reading decodable sentences and gathering
evidence from content-rich texts (through read alouds) on topics to gain purposeful
knowledge and vocabulary.

59A4FE65A3FA442894EF3BD7A2D93C78.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

CC0AD263FDAF4757B8E770A52A827069.description:
Use letter-sound correspondences to read grade-level high frequency words, including
decodable and irregular words, with automaticity and accuracy.

E97BAA22688C4A5F8D9D5291608E2A7E.description:
Decode (read) and encode (spell) words with short vowels, including words beginning or
ending in a digraph (e.g., ch, sh, th, wh).

C776136925CD42788464220C4329C230.description: Demonstrate knowledge of letter-sound correspondences to blend CV, CVC, VC words.

AE52AD14CE294F5FA1B5FE3961433C0F.description: Identify the letter-sound correspondences for consonant digraphs (e.g., ch, sh, th, wh).

EB6040F1A8494630AA1F6201FC8F2B36.description: Demonstrate knowledge that every word has a vowel sound.

472EE9BCEB42452E8093A2A73DD2B953.description:
Discriminate between long and short sounds with common spellings for the five major
vowels with open and closed syllables (e.g., short /e/ as in “pet”, long /e/ as in “he”).

F23C1DA3DF174FF0A15CE5BD88FCB219.description: Identify capital and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

69A944933AD944B28AB35A03FAE174BE.description:
Phonics and Word Analysis: The student will apply phonetic principles to read and
spell words.

2447B6AB13764B8E94784BBBA918CB05.description:
Demonstrate ability to segment and blend one syllable words with two, three, and four
phonemes (including words with consonant digraphs th, sh, ch, wh).

7F0FE419C32B4808A93FFBD8E025E29B.description:
Isolate the initial, medial, and final sounds in three phoneme (individual sound) words
(excluding words ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/).

7F285F9C8FF6455387774AA6FE95E291.description: Blend and segment one syllable words by onset and rime.

91ADC201A6554C1C9302BE704E636E02.description: Demonstrate ability to segment spoken words in sentences and syllables in words.

3F7BF1828CA547F9A809A6C1CE20158D.description:
Phonological and Phonemic Awareness: The student will orally identify and
produce various phonemes (individual sounds) within words to develop phonemic awareness
in support of decoding (reading) and encoding (spelling).

F6306A80D3D54307ADAA222C7916224B.description:
Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending
punctuation).

FB00409073874223B3779487C713E643.description: Identify the front cover, back cover and title of a text.

7A21114E330C4F8CBB54DA491B09E884.description: Identify the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each.

75B92593572F4B76B9A29C41267BDB00.description:
Demonstrate knowledge that spoken words are represented in print and separated by
spaces.

888355417489440499137B51672081C6.description: Demonstrate knowledge of a sentence, word, and letter.

32D96C1B009047C3A6A0CB920A8469EC.description:
Follow words from left to right and from top to bottom on a printed page, including the
return sweep from line to line.

F5DA1A89753E4EDAA53849BA95F70510.description:
Print Concepts: The student will apply knowledge of how print is organized and
read.
